010package imagingbook.common.math;
011
012import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
013
014import java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream;
015import java.io.PrintStream;
016import java.util.Arrays;
017import java.util.Locale;
018
019import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.Array2DRowRealMatrix;
020import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.CholeskyDecomposition;
021import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.DecompositionSolver;
022import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.LUDecomposition;
023import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.MatrixUtils;
024import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException;
025import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealMatrix;
026import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.RealVector;
027import org.apache.commons.math3.linear.SingularMatrixException;
028
029import imagingbook.common.math.exception.DivideByZeroException;
030
031/**
032 * <p>This class defines a set of static methods for calculations
033 * with vectors and matrices using native Java arrays without any enclosing 
034 * object structures. 
035 * Matrices are simple two-dimensional arrays A[r][c], where r is the row index
036 * and c is the column index (as common in linear algebra). This means that
037 * matrices are really vectors of row vectors.
038 * Only arrays of type {@code float} and {@code double} are supported.
039 * All matrices are assumed to be rectangular (i.e., all rows are of equal length).</p>
040 * 
041 * <p>Methods named with a trailing 'D' (e.g., {@link #multiplyD(double, double[])}) 
042 * operate destructively, i.e., modify one of the passed arguments.
043 * Some methods are self-explanatory and are therefore left undocumented.
044 * </p>
045 * 
046 * @author W. Burger
047 * @version 2022/08/29
048 */
049public abstract class Matrix {
050        
051        private Matrix() {}
052        
053        /** Locale used for printing decimal numbers by {@code toString()} methods. */
054        public static Locale PrintLocale = Locale.US;
055        
056        /** Character used to separate successive vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
057        public static char SeparationChar = ',';
058        
059        /** Leading delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
060        public static char LeftDelimitChar = '{';
061        
062        /** Trailing delimiter used for lists of vector and matrix elements by {@code toString()} methods. */
063        public static char RightDelimitChar = '}';
064        
065        // ----  Matrix creation -----------------------------
066        
067        /**
068         * <p>Creates and returns a {@code double[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
069         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
070         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
071         * </p>
072         * <pre>
073         * double[][] A = makeDoubleMatrix(2, 3, 
074         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
075         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
076         * <p>
077         * See also {@link #flatten(double[][])}.
078         * </p>
079         * 
080         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
081         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
082         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
083         * @return a {@code double[][]} matrix
084         */
085        public static double[][] makeDoubleMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
086                final double[][] A = new double[rows][cols];
087                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
088                        return A;
089                }
090                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
091                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
092                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
093                }
094                
095                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
096                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
097                                A[r][c] = values[i];
098                                i++;
099                        }
100                }               
101                return A;
102        }
103        
104        /**
105         * <p>
106         * Creates and returns a {@code float[][]} matrix containing the specified values.
107         * Throws an {@link IllegalArgumentException} if the number of supplied values does
108         * not exactly match the matrix size. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
109         * </p>
110         * <pre>
111         * float[][] A = makeFloatMatrix(2, 3, 
112         *              1.0f, 2.0f, 3.0f,
113         *              4.0f, 5.0f, 6.0f );</pre>
114         * <p>
115         * See also {@link #flatten(float[][])}.
116         * </p>
117         * 
118         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
119         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
120         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code float[]})
121         * @return a {@code float[][]} matrix
122         */
123        public static float[][] makeFloatMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final float... values) {
124                final float[][] A = new float[rows][cols];
125                if (values == null || values.length == 0) {
126                        return A;
127                }
128                else if (values.length != rows * cols) {
129                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("wrong number of matrix values: " 
130                                        + values.length + " instead of " + rows*cols);
131                }       
132                
133                for (int i = 0, r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
134                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
135                                A[r][c] = values[i];
136                                i++;
137                        }
138                }               
139                return A;
140        }
141        
142        /**
143         * <p>
144         * Creates and returns a {@link RealMatrix} containing the specified {@code double} values.
145         * Calls {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}. Example for creating a 2x3 matrix:
146         * </p>
147         * <pre>
148         * RealMatrix A = makeRealMatrix(2, 3, 
149         *              1.0, 2.0, 3.0,
150         *              4.0, 5.0, 6.0 );</pre>
151         * <p>
152         * See also {@link #flatten(RealMatrix)}.
153         * </p>
154         * @param rows the number of matrix rows
155         * @param cols the number of matrix columns
156         * @param values a sequence of matrix values in row-major order (may also be passed as a {@code double[]})
157         * @return a {@link RealMatrix} 
158         */
159        public static RealMatrix makeRealMatrix(final int rows, final int cols, final double... values) {
160                return MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(makeDoubleMatrix(rows, cols, values));
161        }
162        
163
164        /**
165         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
166         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
167         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
168         * See also {@link #makeDoubleMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
169         *  
170         * @param A a matrix
171         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
172         */
173        public static double[] flatten(double[][] A) {
174                final int rows = A.length;
175                final int cols = A[0].length;
176                final double[] vals = new double[rows * cols];
177                int i = 0;
178                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
179                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
180                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
181                                i++;
182                        }
183                }
184                return vals;
185        }
186        
187        /**
188         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code float[]}
189         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
190         * The matrix must be fully rectangular (all rows of same length).
191         * See also {@link #makeFloatMatrix(int, int, float...)}.
192         *  
193         * @param A a matrix
194         * @return a {@code float[]} with the matrix elements
195         */
196        public static float[] flatten(float[][] A) {
197                final int rows = A.length;
198                final int cols = A[0].length;
199                final float[] vals = new float[rows * cols];
200                int i = 0;
201                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
202                        for (int c = 0; c < cols; c++) {
203                                vals[i] = A[r][c];
204                                i++;
205                        }
206                }
207                return vals;
208        }
209        
210        /**
211         * Returns the values of the specified matrix as a {@code double[]}
212         * with elements arranged in row-major order.
213         * See also {@link #makeRealMatrix(int, int, double...)}.
214         *  
215         * @param A a matrix
216         * @return a {@code double[]} with the matrix elements
217         */
218        public static double[] flatten(RealMatrix A) {
219                return flatten(A.getData());
220        }
221        
222        // --------------------------------------------------------------------------
223        
224        /**
225         * Creates and returns a {@code double[]} vector from the
226         * specified values.
227         * 
228         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
229         * @return a {@code double[]}
230         */
231        public static double[] makeDoubleVector(double... values) {
232                return values;
233        }
234        
235        /**
236         * Creates and returns a {@code float[]} vector from the
237         * specified values.
238         * 
239         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code float[]})
240         * @return a {@code float[]}
241         */
242        public static float[] makeFloatVector(float... values) {
243                return values;
244        }
245        
246        /**
247         * Creates and returns a {@link RealVector} from the
248         * specified {@code double} values.
249         * 
250         * @param values a sequence of vector values (may also be passed as a single {@code double[]})
251         * @return a {@link RealVector} 
252         */
253        public static RealVector makeRealVector(double... values) {
254                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(values);
255//              return new ArrayRealVector(values);
256        }
257        
258        // Specific vector/matrix creation:
259        
260        /**
261         * Creates and returns a new zero-valued {@code double[]} vector of the 
262         * specified length.
263         * Throws an exception if the length is less than 1.
264         * @param length the length of the vector
265         * @return a {@code double[]} with zero values
266         */
267        public static double[] zeroVector(int length) {
268                if (length < 1)
269                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("vector size cannot be < 1");
270                return new double[length];
271        }
272        
273        /**
274         * Creates and returns a new identity matrix of the 
275         * specified size.
276         * Throws an exception if the size is less than 1.
277         * @param size the size of the matrix
278         * @return an identity matrix
279         */
280        public static double[][] idMatrix(int size) {
281                if (size < 1)
282                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("matrix size cannot be < 1");
283                double[][] A = new double[size][size];
284                for (int i = 0; i < size; i++) {
285                        A[i][i] = 1;
286                }
287                return A;
288        }
289        
290        // Matrix properties -------------------------------------
291
292        /**
293         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code double} matrix.
294         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
295         * @return the number of rows
296         */
297        public static int getNumberOfRows(double[][] A) {
298                return A.length;
299        }
300        
301        
302        /**
303         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code double} matrix.
304         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
305         * @return the number of columns
306         */
307        public static int getNumberOfColumns(double[][] A) {
308                return A[0].length;
309        }
310        
311        /**
312         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@code float} matrix.
313         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
314         * @return the number of rows
315         */
316        public static int getNumberOfRows(float[][] A) {
317                return A.length;
318        }
319        
320        /**
321         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@code float} matrix.
322         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
323         * @return the number of columns
324         */
325        public static int getNumberOfColumns(float[][] A) {
326                return A[0].length;
327        }
328        
329        /**
330         * Returns the number of rows of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
331         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
332         * @return the number of rows
333         */
334        public static int getNumberOfRows(RealMatrix A) {
335                return A.getRowDimension();
336        }
337        
338        /**
339         * Returns the number of columns of the specified {@link RealMatrix}.
340         * @param A a {@link RealMatrix}
341         * @return the number of columns
342         */
343        public static int getNumberOfColumns(RealMatrix A) {
344                return A.getColumnDimension();
345        }
346        
347        // Extract rows or columns
348        
349        /**
350         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code double} matrix 
351         * as a {@code double} vector.
352         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
353         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
354         * @return a {@code double} vector
355         */
356        public static double[] getRow(double[][] A, int r) {
357                return A[r].clone();
358        }
359        
360        /**
361         * Returns a particular row of the specified {@code float} matrix 
362         * as a {@code float} vector.
363         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
364         * @param r the row index (starting with 0)
365         * @return a {@code float} vector
366         */
367        public static float[] getRow(float[][] A, int r) {
368                return A[r].clone();
369        }
370        
371        /**
372         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code double} matrix 
373         * as a {@code double} vector.
374         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
375         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
376         * @return a {@code double} vector
377         */
378        public static double[] getColumn(double[][] A, int c) {
379                final int rows = A.length;
380                double[] col = new double[rows];
381                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
382                        col[r] = A[r][c];
383                }
384                return col;
385        }
386        
387        /**
388         * Returns a particular column of the specified {@code float} matrix 
389         * as a {@code float} vector.
390         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
391         * @param c the column index (starting with 0)
392         * @return a {@code float} vector
393         */
394        public static float[] getColumn(float[][] A, int c) {
395                final int rows = A.length;
396                float[] col = new float[rows];
397                for (int r = 0; r < rows; r++) {
398                        col[r] = A[r][c];
399                }
400                return col;
401        }
402        
403        // Checking vector/matrix dimensions
404        
405        /**
406         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
407         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
408         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
409         */
410        public static boolean isRectangular(float[][] A) {
411                final int nCols = A[0].length;
412                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
413                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
414                                return false;
415                        }
416                }
417                return true;
418        }
419        
420        /**
421         * Checks if all rows of the given matrix have the same length.
422         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
423         * @return true iff the matrix is rectangular
424         */
425        public static boolean isRectangular(double[][] A) {
426                final int nCols = A[0].length;
427                for (int i = 1; i < A.length; i++) {
428                        if (A[i].length != nCols) {
429                                return false;
430                        }
431                }
432                return true;
433        }
434        
435        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
436         * and columns.
437         * @param A a {@code double[][]} matrix
438         * @return true iff the matrix is square
439         */
440        public static boolean isSquare(double[][] A) {
441                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
442        }
443        
444        /** Checks it the given matrix has the same number of rows
445         * and columns.
446         * @param A a {@code float[][]} matrix
447         * @return true iff the matrix is square
448         */
449        public static boolean isSquare(float[][] A) {
450                return A.length > 0 && A.length == A[0].length;
451        }
452        
453        /**
454         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
455         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
456         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
457         */
458        public static double[] getDiagonal(double[][] A) {
459                if (!isSquare(A)) {
460                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
461                }
462                final int n = A.length;
463                double[] diag = new double[n];
464                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
465                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
466                }
467                return diag;
468        }
469        
470        /**
471         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
472         * @param A a square {@code float[][]} matrix
473         * @return the vector of diagonal elements
474         */
475        public static float[] getDiagonal(float[][] A) {
476                if (!isSquare(A)) {
477                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
478                }
479                final int n = A.length;
480                float[] diag = new float[n];
481                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
482                        diag[i] = A[i][i];
483                }
484                return diag;
485        }
486        
487        /**
488         * Returns a vector with the diagonal elements of the specified matrix.
489         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
490         * @return the {@link RealVector} of diagonal elements
491         */
492        public static RealVector getDiagonal(RealMatrix A) {
493                return MatrixUtils.createRealVector(getDiagonal(A.getData()));
494        }
495        
496        
497        /**
498         * Checks is the given square {@code double[][]} matrix is non-singular.
499         * @param A a square {@code double[][]} matrix
500         * @return true if the matrix is singular
501         */
502        public static boolean isSingular(double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
503                if (!Matrix.isSquare(A)) {
504                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
505                }       
506                return isSingular(new Array2DRowRealMatrix(A));
507        }
508        
509        /**
510         * Checks is the given square matrix is non-singular.
511         * @param A a square {@link RealMatrix}
512         * @return true if the matrix is singular
513         */
514        public static boolean isSingular(RealMatrix A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
515                if (!A.isSquare()) {
516                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
517                }               
518                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
519                return !solver.isNonSingular();
520        }
521        
522        /** Default matrix symmetry tolerance. */
523        public static final double DefaultSymmetryTolerance = 1e-12;
524        
525        /**
526         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
527         * using the specified relative tolerance.
528         * @param A a square matrix
529         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
530         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
531         */
532        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A, double relTolerance) {
533                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(A, relTolerance);
534        }
535        
536        /**
537         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
538         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
539         * @param A a square matrix
540         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
541         */
542        public static boolean isSymmetric(RealMatrix A) {
543                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
544        }
545        
546        /**
547         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric
548         * using the specified relative tolerance.
549         * @param A a square matrix
550         * @param relTolerance relative symmetry tolerance
551         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
552         */
553        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A, double relTolerance) {
554                return MatrixUtils.isSymmetric(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), relTolerance);
555        }
556        
557        /**
558         * Checks is the given square matrix is symmetric,
559         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
560         * @param A a square matrix
561         * @return true if the matrix is symmetric
562         */
563        public static boolean isSymmetric(double[][] A) {
564                return isSymmetric(A, DefaultSymmetryTolerance);
565        }
566        
567        /**
568         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite,
569         * using the specified symmetry tolerance value.
570         * 
571         * @param A a square matrix
572         * @param tolerance the absolute positivity and relative symmetry tolerance
573         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
574         */
575        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A, double tolerance) { //TODO: split tolerance in two parameters
576                try {
577                        new CholeskyDecomposition(A, tolerance, tolerance);
578                        return true;
579                } catch (NonPositiveDefiniteMatrixException e) {};
580                return false;
581        }
582        
583        /**
584         * Checks is the given square matrix is positive definite.
585         * @param A a square matrix
586         * @return true if the matrix is positive definite
587         */
588        public static boolean isPositiveDefinite(RealMatrix A) {
589                return isPositiveDefinite(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
590        }
591        
592        /**
593         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
594         * @param a first vector
595         * @param b second vector
596         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
597         */
598        public static boolean sameSize(double[] a, double[] b) {
599                return a.length == b.length;
600        }
601        
602        /**
603         * Checks if the given vectors have the same length.
604         * @param a first vector
605         * @param b second vector
606         * @return true iff both vectors have the same length
607         */
608        public static boolean sameSize(float[] a, float[] b) {
609                return a.length == b.length;
610        }
611        
612        /**
613         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
614         * @param A first matrix
615         * @param B second matrix
616         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
617         */
618        public static boolean sameSize(double[][] A, double[][] B) {
619                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
620        }
621        
622        /**
623         * Checks if the given matrices have the same size.
624         * @param A first matrix
625         * @param B second matrix
626         * @return true iff both matrices have the same size
627         */
628        public static boolean sameSize(float[][] A, float[][] B) {
629                return (A.length == B.length) && (A[0].length == B[0].length);
630        }
631
632        // Matrix and vector duplication ------------------------------
633
634        
635        public static double[] duplicate(final double[] x) {
636                return x.clone();
637        }
638        
639        public static float[] duplicate(final float[] x) {
640                return x.clone();
641        }
642
643        public static double[][] duplicate(final double[][] A) {
644                final int m = A.length;
645                final double[][] B = new double[m][];
646                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
647                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
648                }
649                return B;
650        }
651        
652        public static float[][] duplicate(final float[][] A) {
653                final int m = A.length;
654                float[][] B = new float[m][];
655                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
656                        B[i] = A[i].clone();
657                }
658                return B;
659        }
660        
661        // ----- double <-> float conversions -----------------
662        
663        public static float[] toFloat(final double[] x) {
664                final int m = x.length;
665                final float[] B = new float[m];
666                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
667                        B[i] = (float) x[i];
668                }
669                return B;
670        }
671        
672        public static float[][] toFloat(final double[][] A) {
673                final int m = A.length;
674                final int n = A[0].length;
675                final float[][] B = new float[m][n];
676                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
677                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
678                                B[i][j] = (float) A[i][j];
679                        }
680                }
681                return B;
682        }
683        
684        public static double[] toDouble(final float[] x) {
685                final int m = x.length;
686                final double[] B = new double[m];
687                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
688                        B[i] = x[i];
689                }
690                return B;
691        }
692        
693        public static double[][] toDouble(final float[][] A) {
694                final int m = A.length;
695                final int n = A[0].length;
696                final double[][] B = new double[m][n];
697                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
698                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
699                                B[i][j] = A[i][j];
700                        }
701                }
702                return B;
703        }
704        
705        // ----------- fill operations (destructive) ------------------------
706        
707        /**
708         * Fills the given {@code double} vector with the specified value (destructively).
709         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
710         * @param val the fill value
711         */
712        public static void fillD(final double[] x, double val) {
713                Arrays.fill(x, val);
714        }
715        
716        /**
717         * Fills the given {@code float} vector with the specified value (destructively).
718         * @param x a vector (which is modified)
719         * @param val the fill value
720         */
721        public static void fillD(final float[] x, float val) {
722                Arrays.fill(x, val);
723        }
724        
725        /**
726         * Fills the given {@code double} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
727         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
728         * @param val the fill value
729         */
730        public static void fillD(final double[][] A, double val) {
731                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
732                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
733                }
734        }
735        
736        /**
737         * Fills the given {@code float} matrix with the specified value (destructively).
738         * @param A a matrix (which is modified)
739         * @param val the fill value
740         */
741        public static void fillD(final float[][] A, float val) {
742                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) { 
743                        Arrays.fill(A[i], val);
744                }
745        }
746        
747
748        // Element-wise arithmetic -------------------------------
749        
750        /**
751         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} vectors
752         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
753         * different lengths.
754         * None of the arguments is modified.
755         * @param a the first vector
756         * @param b the second vector
757         * @return a new {@code double} vector
758         */
759        public static double[] add(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
760                double[] c = b.clone();
761                addD(a, c);
762                return c;
763        }
764        
765        /**
766         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} vector
767         * to the second vector (destructively).
768         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
769         * different lengths.
770         * The second vector is modified.
771         * @param a the first vector
772         * @param b the second vector
773         */
774        public static void addD(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
775                if (!sameSize(a, b))
776                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
777                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
778                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
779                }
780        }
781        
782        /**
783         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} vectors
784         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
785         * different lengths.
786         * None of the arguments is modified.
787         * @param a the first vector
788         * @param b the second vector
789         * @return a new {@code float} vector
790         */
791        public static float[] add(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
792                float[] c = b.clone();
793                addD(a, c);
794                return c;
795        }
796        
797        /**
798         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} vector
799         * to the second vector (destructively).
800         * An exception is thrown if the vectors are of different lengths.
801         * The second vector is modified.
802         * @param a the first vector
803         * @param b the second vector
804         */
805        public static void addD(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
806                if (!sameSize(a, b))
807                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
808                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
809                        b[i] = a[i] + b[i];
810                }
811        }
812
813        /**
814         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code double} matrix
815         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
816         * different size.
817         * None of the arguments is modified.
818         * @param A the first matrix
819         * @param B the second matrix
820         * @return a new {@code double} matrix
821         */
822        public static double[][] add(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
823                double[][] C = duplicate(B);
824                addD(A, C);
825                return C;
826        }
827        
828        /**
829         * Adds the elements of the first {@code double} matrix
830         * to the second vector (destructively).
831         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
832         * different size.
833         * The second matrix is modified.
834         * @param A the first matrix
835         * @param B the second matrix
836         */
837        public static void addD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
838                if (!sameSize(A, B))
839                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
840                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
841                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
842                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
843                        }
844                }
845        }
846        
847        /**
848         * Calculates and returns the sum of the specified {@code float} matrix
849         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
850         * different size.
851         * None of the arguments is modified.
852         * @param A the first matrix
853         * @param B the second matrix
854         * @return a new {@code float} matrix
855         */
856        public static float[][] add(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
857                float[][] C = duplicate(B);
858                addD(A, C);
859                return C;
860        }
861        
862        /**
863         * Adds the elements of the first {@code float} matrix
864         * to the second vector (destructively).
865         * An exception is thrown if the matrices are of
866         * different size.
867         * The second matrix is modified.
868         * @param A the first matrix
869         * @param B the second matrix
870         */
871        public static void addD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
872                if (!sameSize(A, B))
873                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
874                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
875                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
876                                B[i][j] = A[i][j] + B[i][j];
877                        }
878                }
879        }
880        
881        // ------------------------------------------------
882        
883        /**
884         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code double} vectors
885         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
886         * different lengths.
887         * None of the arguments is modified.
888         * @param a the first vector
889         * @param b the second vector
890         * @return a new {@code double} vector
891         */
892        public static double[] subtract(final double[] a, final double[] b) {
893                if (!sameSize(a, b))
894                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
895                final int n = a.length;
896                double[] c = new double[n];
897                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
898                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
899                }
900                return c;
901        }
902        
903        // non-destructive a - b
904        /**
905         * Calculates and returns the difference (a - b) of the specified {@code float} vectors
906         * (non-destructively). An exception is thrown if the vectors are of
907         * different lengths.
908         * None of the arguments is modified.
909         * @param a the first vector
910         * @param b the second vector
911         * @return a new {@code float} vector
912         */
913        public static float[] subtract(final float[] a, final float[] b) {
914                if (!sameSize(a, b))
915                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
916                final int n = a.length;
917                float[] c = new float[n];
918                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
919                        c[i] = a[i] - b[i];
920                }
921                return c;
922        }
923
924        // Scalar multiplications -------------------------------
925
926        // non-destructive
927        /**
928         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
929         * {@code double[]} vector (non-destructive).
930         * @param s a scalar
931         * @param x a vector
932         * @return a new vector
933         */
934        public static double[] multiply(final double s, final double[] x) {
935                double[] b = x.clone();
936                multiplyD(s, b);
937                return b;
938        }
939        
940        // destructive
941        /**
942         * Multiplies a {@code double[]} vector by a scalar.
943         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
944         * @param s a scalar
945         * @param x a vector
946         */
947        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[] x) {
948                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
949                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
950                }
951        }
952        
953
954        // non-destructive
955        /**
956         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
957         * {@code double[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
958         * @param s a scalar
959         * @param A a matrix
960         * @return a new matrix
961         */
962        public static double[][] multiply(final double s, final double[][] A) {
963                double[][] B = duplicate(A);
964                multiplyD(s, B);
965                return B;
966        }
967        
968        /**
969         * Multiplies a {@code double[][]} matrix by a scalar.
970         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
971         * @param s a scalar
972         * @param A a matrix
973         */
974        public static void multiplyD(final double s, final double[][] A) {
975                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
976                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
977                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
978                        }
979                }
980        }
981        
982        // non-destructive
983        /**
984         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar and returns a new
985         * {@code float[]} vector (non-destructive).
986         * @param s a scalar
987         * @param x a vector
988         * @return a new vector
989         */
990        public static float[] multiply(final float s, final float[] x) {
991                float[] B = duplicate(x);
992                multiplyD(s, B);
993                return B;
994        }
995        
996        // destructive
997        /**
998         * Multiplies a {@code float[]} vector by a scalar.
999         * Destructive, i.e., the specified vector is modified.
1000         * @param s a scalar
1001         * @param x a matrix
1002         */
1003        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[] x) {
1004                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1005                        x[i] = x[i] * s;
1006                }
1007        }
1008
1009        // non-destructive
1010        /**
1011         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar and returns a new
1012         * {@code float[][]} matrix (non-destructive).
1013         * @param s a scalar
1014         * @param A a matrix
1015         * @return a new matrix
1016         */
1017        public static float[][] multiply(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1018                float[][] B = duplicate(A);
1019                multiplyD(s, B);
1020                return B;
1021        }
1022        
1023        // destructive
1024        /**
1025         * Multiplies a {@code float[][]} matrix by a scalar.
1026         * Destructive, i.e., the specified matrix is modified.
1027         * @param s a scalar
1028         * @param A a matrix
1029         */
1030        public static void multiplyD(final float s, final float[][] A) {
1031                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1032                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1033                                A[i][j] = A[i][j] * s;
1034                        }
1035                }
1036        }
1037        
1038        // matrix-vector multiplications ----------------------------------------
1039
1040        /**
1041         * Multiplies a vector x with a matrix A "from the left", i.e., y = x * A,
1042         * where x is treated as a row vector and the result y is also a row vector.
1043         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1044         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1045         * @return a (row) vector of length n
1046         */
1047        public static double[] multiply(final double[] x, final double[][] A) {
1048                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1049                multiplyD(x, A, y);
1050                return y;
1051        }
1052        
1053        /**
1054         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[], double[][])}.
1055         * @param x a (row) vector of length m
1056         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1057         * @param y a (row) vector of length n
1058         */
1059        public static void multiplyD(final double[] x, final double[][] A, double[] y) {
1060                if (x == y) 
1061                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1062                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1063                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1064                if (x.length != m || y.length != n) 
1065                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1066                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
1067                        double s = 0;
1068                        for (int j = 0; j < m; j++) {
1069                                s = s + x[j] * A[j][i];
1070                        }
1071                        y[i] = s;
1072                }
1073        }
1074
1075        /**
1076         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1077         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1078         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1079         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1080         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1081         */
1082        public static double[] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[] x) {
1083                double[] y = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1084                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1085                return y;
1086        }
1087        
1088        /**
1089         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1090         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1091         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1092         * which is modified.
1093         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(double[][], double[])}.
1094         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1095         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1096         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1097         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1098         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1099         */
1100        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[] x, double[] y) {
1101                if (x == y) 
1102                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1103                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1104                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1105                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1106                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1107                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1108                        double s = 0;
1109                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1110                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1111                        }
1112                        y[i] = s;
1113                }
1114        }
1115        
1116        /**
1117         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x from the right, i.e., y = A * x,
1118         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1119         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1120         * @param A a matrix of size (m,n)
1121         * @return a (column) vector of length m
1122         */
1123        public static float[] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[] x) {
1124                float[] y = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1125                multiplyD(A, x, y);
1126                return y;
1127        }
1128        
1129        /**
1130         * Multiplies a matrix A with a vector x "from the right", i.e., y = A * x,
1131         * where x is treated as a column vector and the result y is also a column vector.
1132         * The result is placed in the vector passed as the last argument, 
1133         * which is modified.
1134         * Destructive version of {@link #multiply(float[][], float[])}.
1135         * An exception is thrown if any matrix or vector dimensions do not match
1136         * or if the two vectors are the same.
1137         * @param A matrix of size (m,n)
1138         * @param x a (column) vector of length n
1139         * @param y a (column) vector of length m
1140         */
1141        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[] x, float[] y) {
1142                if (x == y) 
1143                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1144                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1145                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1146                if (x.length != n || y.length != m) 
1147                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1148                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1149                        double s = 0;
1150                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1151                                s = s + A[i][j] * x[j];
1152                        }
1153                        y[i] = (float) s;
1154                }
1155        }
1156        
1157
1158        
1159        // Matrix-matrix products ---------------------------------------
1160        
1161        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1162        /**
1163         * Returns the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1164         * as a new {@code double[][]} matrix.
1165         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1166         * @param A first matrix
1167         * @param B second matrix
1168         * @return the matrix product A * B
1169         */
1170        public static double[][] multiply(final double[][] A, final double[][] B) {
1171                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1172                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1173                if (nA != mB)
1174                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1175                int ma = getNumberOfRows(A);
1176                int nb = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1177                double[][] C = makeDoubleMatrix(ma, nb);
1178                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1179                return C;
1180        }
1181        
1182        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1183        /**
1184         * Calculates the product of two {@code double[][]} matrices A, B
1185         * and places the results in the third {@code double[][]} matrix C,
1186         * which is modified (destructively).
1187         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1188         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1189         * @param A first matrix
1190         * @param B second matrix
1191         * @param C the result matrix
1192         */
1193        public static void multiplyD(final double[][] A, final double[][] B, final double[][] C) 
1194                        throws SameSourceTargetException, IncompatibleDimensionsException {
1195                if (A == C || B == C) 
1196                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1197                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1198                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1199                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1200                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1201                if (nA != mB)
1202                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1203                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1204                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1205                
1206                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1207                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1208                                double s = 0;
1209                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1210                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1211                                }
1212                                C[i][j] = s;
1213                        }
1214                }
1215        }
1216        
1217        // returns A * B (non-destructive)
1218        /**
1219         * Returns the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1220         * as a new {@code float[][]} matrix.
1221         * Non-destructive, i.e., none of the arguments is modified.
1222         * @param A first matrix
1223         * @param B second matrix
1224         * @return the matrix product A * B
1225         */
1226        public static float[][] multiply(final float[][] A, final float[][] B) {
1227                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1228                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1229                if (nA != mB)
1230                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A, B
1231                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1232                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1233                float[][] C = makeFloatMatrix(mA, nB);
1234                multiplyD(A, B, C);
1235                return C;
1236        }
1237
1238        // A * B -> C (destructive)
1239        /**
1240         * Calculates the product of two {@code float[][]} matrices A, B
1241         * and places the results in the third {@code float[][]} matrix C,
1242         * which is modified (destructively).
1243         * An exception is thrown if any matrix dimensions do not match
1244         * or if the target matrix is the same as one of the source matrices.
1245         * @param A first matrix
1246         * @param B second matrix
1247         * @param C the result matrix
1248         */
1249        public static void multiplyD(final float[][] A, final float[][] B, final float[][] C) {
1250                if (A == C || B == C) 
1251                        throw new SameSourceTargetException();
1252                final int mA = getNumberOfRows(A);
1253                final int nA = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1254                final int mB = getNumberOfRows(B);
1255                final int nB = getNumberOfColumns(B);
1256                if (nA != mB)
1257                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of A,B
1258                if (mA != getNumberOfRows(C) || nB != getNumberOfColumns(C))
1259                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();    // check size of C
1260                for (int i = 0; i < mA; i++) {
1261                        for (int j = 0; j < nB; j++) {
1262                                float s = 0;
1263                                for (int k = 0; k < nA; k++) {
1264                                        s = s + A[i][k] * B[k][j];
1265                                }
1266                                C[i][j] = s;
1267                        }
1268                }
1269        }
1270        
1271        // Vector-vector products ---------------------------------------
1272        
1273        /**
1274         * Calculates and returns the dot (inner or scalar) product of two vectors,
1275         * which must have the same length.
1276         * Throws an exceptions if vector dimensions do not match.
1277         * @param x first vector
1278         * @param y second vector
1279         * @return the dot product
1280         */
1281        public static double dotProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
1282                if (!sameSize(x, y))
1283                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
1284                double sum = 0;
1285                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1286                        sum = sum + x[i] * y[i];
1287                }
1288                return sum;
1289        }
1290        
1291        // A is considered a column vector, B is a row vector, of length m, n, resp.
1292        // returns a matrix M of size (m,n).
1293        /**
1294         * Calculates and returns the outer product of two vectors, which is a
1295         * matrix of size (m,n), where m is the length of the first vector and
1296         * m is the length of the second vector.
1297         * @param x first vector (of length m)
1298         * @param y second vector (of length n)
1299         * @return the outer product (matrix)
1300         */
1301        public static double[][] outerProduct(final double[] x, final double[] y) {
1302                final int m = x.length;
1303                final int n = y.length;
1304                final double[][] M = new double[m][n];
1305                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1306                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1307                                M[i][j] = x[i] * y[j];
1308                        }
1309                }
1310                return M;
1311        }
1312
1313        //  Vector norms ---------------------------------------------------
1314
1315        /**
1316         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1317         * @param x a vector
1318         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1319         */
1320        public static double normL1(final double[] x) {
1321                double sum = 0;
1322                for (double val : x) {
1323                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1324                }
1325                return sum;
1326        }
1327        
1328        /**
1329         * Calculates and returns the L1 norm of the given vector.
1330         * @param x a vector
1331         * @return the L1 norm of the vector
1332         */
1333        public static float normL1(final float[] x) {
1334                double sum = 0;
1335                for (double val : x) {
1336                        sum = sum + Math.abs(val);
1337                }
1338                return (float) sum;
1339        }
1340
1341        /**
1342         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1343         * @param x a vector
1344         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1345         */
1346        public static double normL2(final double[] x) {
1347                return Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1348        }
1349
1350        /**
1351         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1352         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1353         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1354         * @param x a vector
1355         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1356         */
1357        public static double normL2squared(final double[] x) {
1358                double sum = 0;
1359                for (double val : x) {
1360                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1361                }
1362                return sum;
1363        }
1364
1365        /**
1366         * Calculates and returns the L2 norm of the given vector.
1367         * @param x a vector
1368         * @return the L2 norm of the vector
1369         */
1370        public static float normL2(final float[] x) {
1371                return (float) Math.sqrt(normL2squared(x));
1372        }
1373
1374        /**
1375         * Calculates and returns the squared L2 norm of the given vector.
1376         * The squared norm is less costly to calculate (no square root
1377         * needed) than the L2 norm and is thus often used for efficiency. 
1378         * @param x a vector
1379         * @return the squared L2 norm of the vector
1380         */
1381        public static double normL2squared(final float[] x) {
1382                double sum = 0;
1383                for (double val : x) {
1384                        sum = sum + sqr(val);
1385                }
1386                return sum;
1387        }
1388        
1389        // Normalize vectors
1390        
1391        /**
1392         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1393         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code double[]} vector.
1394         * @param x a vector
1395         * @return the normalized vector
1396         */
1397        public static double[] normalize(final double[] x) {
1398                double[] xx = duplicate(x);
1399                normalizeD(xx);
1400                return xx;
1401        }
1402        
1403        /**
1404         * Normalizes the specified {@code double[]} vector to unit
1405         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1406         * @param x a vector
1407         */
1408        public static void normalizeD(final double[] x) {
1409                double normx = normL2(x);
1410                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1411                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1412                multiplyD(1.0 / normx, x);
1413        }
1414        
1415        /**
1416         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1417         * (L2) norm and returns the result as a new {@code float[]} vector.
1418         * @param x a vector
1419         * @return the normalized vector
1420         */
1421        public static float[] normalize(final float[] x) {
1422                float[] xx = duplicate(x);
1423                normalizeD(xx);
1424                return xx;
1425        }
1426        
1427        /**
1428         * Normalizes the specified {@code float[]} vector to unit
1429         * (L2) norm. The vector is modified (destructively).
1430         * @param x a vector
1431         */
1432        public static void normalizeD(final float[] x) {
1433                double normx = normL2(x);
1434                if (Arithmetic.isZero(normx))
1435                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("cannot normalize zero-norm vector");
1436                multiplyD((float) (1.0 / normx), x);
1437        }
1438        
1439        // Distance between vectors ---------------------------------------
1440        
1441        /** 
1442         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1443         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1444         * number of elements.
1445         * @param x first vector
1446         * @param y second vector
1447         * @return the distance
1448         */
1449        public static double distL2(double[] x, double[] y) {
1450                return Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
1451        }
1452        
1453        /** 
1454         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1455         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1456         * number of elements.
1457         * @param x first vector
1458         * @param y second vector
1459         * @return the squared distance
1460         */
1461        public static double distL2squared(double[] x, double[] y) {
1462                double sum = 0;
1463                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1464                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
1465                }
1466                return sum;
1467        }
1468        
1469        /** 
1470         * Calculates the L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1471         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1472         * number of elements.
1473         * @param x first vector
1474         * @param y second vector
1475         * @return the distance
1476         */
1477        public static float distL2(float[] x, float[] y) {
1478                return (float) Math.sqrt(distL2squared(x, y));
1479        }
1480        
1481        /** 
1482         * Calculates the squared L2 distance between two vectors (points)
1483         * in n-dimensional space. Both vectors must have the same 
1484         * number of elements.
1485         * @param x first vector
1486         * @param y second vector
1487         * @return the squared distance
1488         */
1489        public static float distL2squared(float[] x, float[] y) {
1490                double sum = 0;
1491                for  (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1492                        sum = sum + sqr(x[i] - y[i]);
1493                }
1494                return (float) sum;
1495        }
1496        
1497        // Matrix (Froebenius) norm ---------------------------------------
1498        
1499        /**
1500         * Calculates and returns the Froebenius norm of the given matrix.
1501         * @param A a matrix
1502         * @return the norm of the matrix
1503         */
1504        public static double norm(final double[][] A) {
1505                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
1506                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
1507                double s = 0;
1508                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
1509                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
1510                                s = s + sqr(A[i][j]);
1511                        }
1512                }
1513                return Math.sqrt(s);
1514        }
1515
1516        // Summation --------------------------------------------------
1517
1518        /**
1519         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1520         * {@code double[]} vector.
1521         * @param x a vector
1522         * @return the sum of vector elements
1523         */
1524        public static double sum(final double[] x) {
1525                double sum = 0;
1526                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1527                        sum = sum + x[i];
1528                }
1529                return sum;
1530        }
1531        
1532        /**
1533         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1534         * {@code double[][]} matrix.
1535         * @param A a matrix
1536         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1537         */
1538        public static double sum(final double[][] A) {
1539                double sum = 0;
1540                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1541                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1542                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1543                        }
1544                }
1545                return sum;
1546        }
1547        
1548        /**
1549         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1550         * {@code float[]} vector.
1551         * @param x a vector
1552         * @return the sum of vector elements
1553         */
1554        public static float sum(final float[] x) {
1555                double sum = 0;
1556                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1557                        sum = sum + x[i];
1558                }
1559                return (float) sum;
1560        }
1561        
1562        /**
1563         * Calculates and returns the sum of the elements in the specified 
1564         * {@code float[][]} matrix.
1565         * @param A a matrix
1566         * @return the sum of matrix elements
1567         */
1568        public static double sum(final float[][] A) {
1569                double sum = 0;
1570                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
1571                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1572                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1573                        }
1574                }
1575                return sum;
1576        }

1580        /**
1581         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1582         * @param A a matrix
1583         * @param row the row index
1584         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1585         */
1586        public static double sumRow(final double[][] A, final int row) {
1587                return sum(A[row]);
1588        }
1589        
1590        /**
1591         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix row.
1592         * @param A a matrix
1593         * @param row the row index
1594         * @return the sum of the row's elements
1595         */
1596        public static float sumRow(final float[][] A, final int row) {
1597                return sum(A[row]);
1598        }
