1600
1601        /**
1602         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1603         * @param A a matrix
1604         * @param col the column index
1605         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1606         */
1607        public static double sumColumn(final double[][] A, final int col) {
1608                double sum = 0;
1609                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1610                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1611                }
1612                return sum;
1613        }
1614        
1615        /**
1616         * Calculates the sum of the elements in the specified matrix column.
1617         * @param A a matrix
1618         * @param col the column index
1619         * @return the sum of the column's elements
1620         */
1621        public static float sumColumn(final float[][] A, final int col) {
1622                double sum = 0;
1623                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1624                        sum = sum + A[r][col];
1625                }
1626                return (float) sum;
1627        }
1628        
1629        /**
1630         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1631         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1632         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1633         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1634         */
1635        public static double[] sumRows(final double[][] A) {
1636                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1637                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1638                        double sum = 0;
1639                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1640                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1641                        }
1642                        sumVec[i] = sum;
1643                }
1644                return sumVec;
1645        }
1646        
1647        /**
1648         * Calculates the sums of all matrix rows and returns 
1649         * them as a vector with one element per row.
1650         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1651         * @return a vector of length M containing the sums of all matrix columns
1652         */
1653        public static float[] sumRows(final float[][] A) {
1654                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfRows(A)];
1655                for (int i = 0; i < sumVec.length; i++) {
1656                        double sum = 0;
1657                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
1658                                sum = sum + A[i][j];
1659                        }
1660                        sumVec[i] = (float) sum;
1661                }
1662                return sumVec;
1663        }
1664        
1665        /**
1666         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1667         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1668         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1669         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1670         */
1671        public static double[] sumColumns(final double[][] A) {
1672                double[] sumVec = new double[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1673                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1674                        double sum = 0;
1675                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1676                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1677                        }
1678                        sumVec[c] = sum;
1679                }
1680                return sumVec;
1681        }
1682        
1683        /**
1684         * Calculates the sums of all matrix columns and returns
1685         * them as a vector with one element per column.
1686         * @param A a matrix of size (M,N)
1687         * @return a vector of length N containing the sums of all matrix rows
1688         */
1689        public static float[] sumColumns(final float[][] A) {
1690                float[] sumVec = new float[getNumberOfColumns(A)];
1691                for (int c = 0; c < sumVec.length; c++) {
1692                        double sum = 0;
1693                        for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1694                                sum = sum + A[r][c];
1695                        }
1696                        sumVec[c] = (float) sum;
1697                }
1698                return sumVec;
1699        }
1700        
1701        // min/max of vectors ------------------------
1702        
1703        /**
1704         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1705         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1706         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1707         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1708         * 
1709         * @param x a vector
1710         * @return the index of the smallest value
1711         */
1712        public static int idxMin(double[] x) {
1713                if (x.length == 0)
1714                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1715                double minval = x[0];
1716                int minidx = 0;
1717                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1718                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1719                                minval = x[i];
1720                                minidx = i;
1721                        }
1722                }
1723                return minidx;
1724        }
1725        
1726        /**
1727         * Returns the index of the smallest element in the
1728         * specified vector. If the smallest value is
1729         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1730         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1731         * 
1732         * @param x a vector
1733         * @return the index of the smallest value
1734         */
1735        public static int idxMin(float[] x) {
1736                if (x.length == 0)
1737                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1738                float minval = x[0];
1739                int minidx = 0;
1740                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1741                        if (x[i] < minval) {
1742                                minval = x[i];
1743                                minidx = i;
1744                        }
1745                }
1746                return minidx;
1747        }
1748        
1749        
1750        /**
1751         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1752         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1753         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1754         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1755         * 
1756         * @param x a vector
1757         * @return the index of the largest value
1758         */
1759        public static int idxMax(double[] x) {
1760                if (x.length == 0)
1761                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1762                double maxval = x[0];
1763                int maxidx = 0;
1764                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1765                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1766                                maxval = x[i];
1767                                maxidx = i;
1768                        }
1769                }
1770                return maxidx;
1771        }
1772        
1773        /**
1774         * Returns the index of the largest element in the
1775         * specified vector. If the largest value is
1776         * not unique, the lowest index is returned.
1777         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1778         * 
1779         * @param x a vector
1780         * @return the index of the largest value
1781         */
1782        public static int idxMax(float[] x) {
1783                if (x.length == 0)
1784                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1785                float maxval = x[0];
1786                int maxidx = 0;
1787                for (int i = 1; i < x.length; i++) {
1788                        if (x[i] > maxval) {
1789                                maxval = x[i];
1790                                maxidx = i;
1791                        }
1792                }
1793                return maxidx;
1794        }
1795        
1796        
1797        /**
1798         * Returns the smallest value in the
1799         * specified vector. 
1800         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1801         * @param x a vector
1802         * @return the largest value
1803         */
1804        public static float min(final float[] x) {
1805                if (x.length == 0)
1806                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1807                float minval = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1808                for (float val : x) {
1809                        if (val < minval) {
1810                                minval = val;
1811                        }
1812                }
1813                return minval;
1814        }
1815        
1816        /**
1817         * Returns the smallest value in the
1818         * specified vector. 
1819         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1820         * @param x a vector
1821         * @return the largest value
1822         */
1823        public static double min(final double[] x) {
1824                if (x.length == 0)
1825                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1826                double minval = Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
1827                for (double val : x) {
1828                        if (val < minval) {
1829                                minval = val;
1830                        }
1831                }
1832                return minval;
1833        }
1834        
1835        /**
1836         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[]} vector. 
1837         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1838         * @param x a vector
1839         * @return the largest value
1840         */
1841        public static double max(final double[] x) {
1842                if (x.length == 0)
1843                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1844                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1845                for (double val : x) {
1846                        if (val > maxval) {
1847                                maxval = val;
1848                        }
1849                }
1850                return maxval;
1851        }
1852
1853        /**
1854         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[]} vector. 
1855         * An exception is thrown if the vector has zero length.
1856         * @param x a vector
1857         * @return the largest value
1858         */
1859        public static float max(final float[] x) {
1860                if (x.length == 0)
1861                        throw new ZeroLengthVectorException();
1862                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1863                for (float val : x) {
1864                        if (val > maxval) {
1865                                maxval = val;
1866                        }
1867                }
1868                return maxval;
1869        }
1870        
1871        /**
1872         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code double[][]} matrix. 
1873         * @param A a matrix
1874         * @return the largest matrix value
1875         */
1876        public static double max(double[][] A) {
1877                double maxval = Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1878                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1879                        for (double val : A[r]) {
1880                                if (val > maxval) {
1881                                        maxval = val;
1882                                }
1883                        }
1884                }
1885                return maxval;
1886        }
1887        
1888        /**
1889         * Returns the largest value in the specified {@code float[][]} matrix. 
1890         * @param A a matrix
1891         * @return the largest matrix value
1892         */
1893        public static float max(float[][] A) {
1894                float maxval = Float.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;
1895                for (int r = 0; r < A.length; r++) {
1896                        for (float val : A[r]) {
1897                                if (val > maxval) {
1898                                        maxval = val;
1899                                }
1900                        }
1901                }
1902                return maxval;
1903        }
1904        
1905        // Vector concatenation -----------------------
1906        
1907        /**
1908         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1909         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1910         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1911         */
1912        public static float[] join(float[]... xs) {
1913                int n = 0;
1914                for (float[] x : xs) {
1915                        n = n + x.length;
1916                }
1917                float[] va = new float[n];
1918                int j = 0;
1919                for (float[] x : xs) {
1920                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1921                                va[j] = x[i];
1922                                j++;
1923                        }
1924                }               
1925                return va;
1926        }
1927
1928        /**
1929         * Joins (concatenates) a sequence of vectors into a single vector.
1930         * @param xs a sequence of vectors (at least one vector)
1931         * @return a vector containing all elements of the input vectors
1932         */
1933        public static double[] join(double[]... xs) {
1934                int n = 0;
1935                for (double[] x : xs) {
1936                        n = n + x.length;
1937                }
1938                double[] va = new double[n];    
1939                int j = 0;
1940                for (double[] x : xs) {
1941                        for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
1942                                va[j] = x[i];
1943                                j++;
1944                        }
1945                }               
1946                return va;
1947        }
1948        
1949        // Vector linear interpolation ---------------------------------
1950        
1951        /**
1952         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1953         * which must have the same length.
1954         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1955         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1956         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1957         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1958         * @return the interpolated vector
1959         */
1960        public static float[] lerp(float[] a, float[] b, final float t) {
1961                final float[] c = new float[a.length];
1962                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1963                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1964                }
1965                return c;
1966        }
1967        
1968        /**
1969         * Performs linear interpolation between two vectors {@code a} and {@code b}, 
1970         * which must have the same length.
1971         * Returns a new vector {@code c = a + t * (b - a)}.
1972         * @param a first vector (to be interpolated from)
1973         * @param b second vector (to be interpolated to)
1974         * @param t interpolation coefficient, expected to be in [0,1]
1975         * @return the interpolated vector
1976         */
1977        public static double[] lerp(double[] a, double[] b, final double t) {
1978                final double[] c = new double[a.length];
1979                for (int i = 0; i < a.length; i++) {
1980                        c[i] = a[i] + t * (b[i] - a[i]);
1981                }
1982                return c;
1983        }
1984        
1985        
1986        // Homogeneous coordinates ---------------------------------
1987        
1988        /**
1989         * Converts a Cartesian vector to an equivalent homogeneous
1990         * vector by attaching an additional 1-element.
1991         * The resulting homogeneous vector is one element longer than the 
1992         * specified Cartesian vector.
1993         * See also {@link #toCartesian(double[])}.
1994         * @param xc a Cartesian vector
1995         * @return an equivalent homogeneous vector
1996         */
1997        public static double[] toHomogeneous(double[] xc) {
1998                double[] xh = new double[xc.length + 1];
1999                for (int i = 0; i < xc.length; i++) {
2000                        xh[i] = xc[i];
2001                        xh[xh.length - 1] = 1;
2002                }
2003                return xh;
2004        }
2005        
2006        /**
2007         * Converts a homogeneous vector to its equivalent Cartesian
2008         * vector, which is one element shorter.
2009         * See also {@link #toHomogeneous(double[])}.
2010         * @param xh a homogeneous vector
2011         * @return the equivalent Cartesian vector
2012         */
2013        public static double[] toCartesian(double[] xh) throws DivideByZeroException {
2014                double[] xc = new double[xh.length - 1];
2015                final double s = 1 / xh[xh.length - 1];
2016                if (!Double.isFinite(s))        // isZero(s)
2017                        throw new DivideByZeroException();
2018                for (int i = 0; i < xh.length - 1; i++) {
2019                        xc[i] = s * xh[i];
2020                }
2021                return xc;
2022        }
2023        
2024        // Determinants --------------------------------------------
2025        
2026        /**
2027         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@link RealMatrix}.
2028         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2029         * @param A a square matrix
2030         * @return the determinant
2031         */
2032        public static double determinant(RealMatrix A) {
2033                if (!A.isSquare())
2034                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2035                return new LUDecomposition(A).getDeterminant();
2036        }
2037        
2038        /**
2039         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2040         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2041         * @param A a square matrix
2042         * @return the determinant
2043         */
2044        public static double determinant(final double[][] A) {
2045                return determinant(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A));
2046        }
2047        
2048        /**
2049         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2050         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2051         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2052         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2053         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2054         * @return the determinant
2055         */
2056        public static double determinant2x2(final double[][] A) {
2057                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2058                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2059                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2060        }
2061        
2062        /**
2063         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 2x2 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2064         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 2x2.
2065         * @param A a 2x2 matrix
2066         * @return the determinant
2067         */
2068        public static float determinant2x2(final float[][] A) {
2069                if (A.length != 2 || A[0].length != 2)
2070                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2071                return A[0][0] * A[1][1] - A[0][1] * A[1][0];
2072        }
2073        
2074
2075        /**
2076         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code double[][]} matrix.
2077         * This method is hard-coded for the specific matrix size for better performance
2078         * than the general method ({@link #determinant(double[][])}).
2079         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2080         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2081         * @return the determinant
2082         */
2083        public static double determinant3x3(final double[][] A) {
2084                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2085                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2086                return 
2087                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] + 
2088                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0]     + 
2089                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] - 
2090                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] - 
2091                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] - 
2092                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2093        }
2094        
2095        /**
2096         * Calculates and returns the determinant of the given 3x3 {@code float[][]} matrix.
2097         * Throws an exception if the matrix is not 3x3.
2098         * @param A a 3x3 matrix
2099         * @return the determinant
2100         */
2101        public static float determinant3x3(final float[][] A) {
2102                if (A.length != 3 || A[0].length != 3)
2103                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2104                return
2105                        A[0][0] * A[1][1] * A[2][2] +
2106                        A[0][1] * A[1][2] * A[2][0] +
2107                        A[0][2] * A[1][0] * A[2][1] -
2108                        A[2][0] * A[1][1] * A[0][2] -
2109                        A[2][1] * A[1][2] * A[0][0] -
2110                        A[2][2] * A[1][0] * A[0][1] ;
2111        }
2112
2113
2114        
2115        // Matrix trace ---------------------------------------
2116        
2117        /**
2118         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2119         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2120         * @param A a square matrix
2121         * @return the trace 
2122         */
2123        public static double trace(final double[][] A) {
2124                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2125                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2126                if (m != n) 
2127                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2128                double s = 0;
2129                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2130                                s = s + A[i][i];
2131                }
2132                return s;
2133        }
2134        
2135        /**
2136         * Calculates and returns the trace of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2137         * Throws an exception if the matrix is non-square.
2138         * @param A a square matrix
2139         * @return the trace 
2140         */
2141        public static float trace(final float[][] A) {
2142                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2143                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2144                if (m != n) 
2145                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2146                double s = 0;
2147                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2148                                s = s + A[i][i];
2149                }
2150                return (float) s;
2151        }
2152        
2153        // Matrix transposition ---------------------------------------
2154        
2155        /**
2156         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code double[][]} matrix.
2157         * The original matrix is not modified.
2158         * @param A a matrix
2159         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2160         */
2161        public static double[][] transpose(double[][] A) {
2162                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2163                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2164                double[][] At = new double[n][m];
2165                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2166                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2167                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2168                        }
2169                }
2170                return At;
2171        }
2172        
2173        /**
2174         * Returns the transpose of the given {@code float[][]} matrix.
2175         * The original matrix is not modified.
2176         * @param A a matrix
2177         * @return the transpose of the matrix
2178         */
2179        public static float[][] transpose(float[][] A) {
2180                final int m = getNumberOfRows(A);
2181                final int n = getNumberOfColumns(A);
2182                float[][] At = new float[n][m];
2183                for (int i = 0; i < m; i++) {
2184                        for (int j = 0; j < n; j++) {
2185                                At[j][i] = A[i][j];
2186                        }
2187                }
2188                return At;
2189        }
2190        
2191        
2192        // Checking vectors for all zero values  ------------------------------
2193        
2194        /**
2195         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2196         * using the specified tolerance value.
2197         * @param x a vector
2198         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2199         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2200         */
2201        public static boolean isZero(double[] x, double tolerance) {
2202                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2203                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
2204                                return false;
2205                        }
2206                }
2207                return true;
2208        }
2209        
2210        /**
2211         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[]} vector are zero
2212         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2213         * @param x a vector
2214         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2215         */
2216        public static boolean isZero(double[] x) {
2217                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2218        }
2219        
2220        /**
2221         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2222         * using the specified tolerance value.
2223         * @param x a vector
2224         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2225         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2226         */
2227        public static boolean isZero(float[] x, float tolerance) {
2228                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2229                        if (!Arithmetic.isZero(x[i], tolerance)) {
2230                                return false;
2231                        }
2232                }
2233                return true;
2234        }
2235        
2236        /**
2237         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code float[]} vector are zero
2238         * using the default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2239         * @param x a vector
2240         * @return true if all vector elements are smaller than the tolerance
2241         */
2242        public static boolean isZero(float[] x) {
2243                return isZero(x, Arithmetic.EPSILON_FLOAT);
2244        }
2245        
2246        // Checking matrices for all zero values  ------------------------------
2247        
2248        /**
2249         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2250         * using the specified tolerance value.
2251         * @param A a matrix
2252         * @param tolerance the tolerance value
2253         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2254         */
2255        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A, double tolerance) {
2256                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {    // for each matrix row i
2257                        if (!Matrix.isZero(A[i], tolerance)) {
2258                                return false;
2259                        }
2260                }
2261                return true;
2262        }
2263        
2264        /**
2265         * Checks if all elements of the specified {@code double[][]} matrix are zero
2266         * using default tolerance value ({@link Arithmetic#EPSILON_DOUBLE}).
2267         * @param A a matrix
2268         * @return true if all matrix elements are smaller than the tolerance
2269         */
2270        public static boolean isZero(double[][] A) {
2271                return isZero(A, Arithmetic.EPSILON_DOUBLE);
2272        }
2273        
2274        // Sorting vectors (non-destructively)  ------------------------------
2275        
2276        public static double[] sort(double[] x) {
2277                double[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
2278                Arrays.sort(y);
2279                return y;
2280        }
2281        
2282        public static float[] sort(float[] x) {
2283                float[] y = Arrays.copyOf(x, x.length);
2284                Arrays.sort(y);
2285                return y;
2286        }
2287        
2288        // Matrix inversion ---------------------------------------
2289        
2290        /**
2291         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2292         * must be square. Exceptions are n if the supplied matrix is
2293         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2294         * @param A a square matrix
2295         * @return the inverse matrix
2296         */
2297        public static double[][] inverse(final double[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2298                if (!isSquare(A))
2299                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2300                RealMatrix M = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A);
2301                return MatrixUtils.inverse(M).getData();
2302        }
2303        
2304        /**
2305         * Calculates and returns the inverse of the given matrix, which
2306         * must be square. Exceptions are thrown if the supplied matrix is
2307         * not square or ill-conditioned (singular).
2308         * @param A a square matrix
2309         * @return the inverse matrix
2310         */
2311        public static float[][] inverse(final float[][] A) throws NonsquareMatrixException {
2312                if (!isSquare(A))
2313                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2314                double[][] Ad = toDouble(A);
2315                return toFloat(inverse(Ad));
2316        }
2317
2318        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------
2319        
2320        /**
2321         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2322         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2323         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2324         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2325         * Calls {@link #solve(RealMatrix, RealVector)}.
2326         * 
2327         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2328         * @param b a vector of length n
2329         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2330         */
2331        
2332        public static double[] solve(final double[][] A, double[] b) {
2333                RealVector x = solve(MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(A), MatrixUtils.createRealVector(b));
2334                return (x == null) ? null : x.toArray();
2335        }
2336        
2337        /**
2338         * Finds the exact solution x for the linear system of equations
2339         * A * x = b. Returns the solution vector x or {@code null}
2340         * if the supplied matrix is ill-conditioned (i.e., singular).
2341         * Exceptions are thrown if A is not square or dimensions are incompatible.
2342         * Uses {@link LUDecomposition} from the Apache Commons Math library.
2343         * 
2344         * @param A a square matrix of size n x n
2345         * @param b a vector of length n
2346         * @return the solution vector (x) of length n or {@code null} if no solution possible
2347         */
2348        public static RealVector solve(RealMatrix A, RealVector b) {
2349                if (!A.isSquare()) {
2350                        throw new NonsquareMatrixException();
2351                }
2352                if (A.getRowDimension() != b.getDimension()) {
2353                        throw new IncompatibleDimensionsException();
2354                }
2355//              DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A, 0.0).getSolver();
2356                DecompositionSolver solver = new LUDecomposition(A).getSolver();
2357                RealVector x = null;
2358                try {
2359                        x = solver.solve(b);
2360                } catch (SingularMatrixException e) {}
2361                return x;
2362        }
2363        
2364        // Output to strings and streams ------------------------------------------
2365        
2366        public static String toString(double[] x) {
2367                if (x == null) {
2368                        return String.valueOf(x);
2369                }
2370                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2371                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2372                printToStream(x, strm);
2373                return bas.toString();
2374        }
2375        
2376        public static String toString(float[] x) {
2377                if (x == null) {
2378                        return String.valueOf(x);
2379                }
2380                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2381                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2382                printToStream(x, strm);
2383                return bas.toString();
2384        }
2385        
2386        public static String toString(double[][] A) {
2387                if (A == null) {
2388                        return String.valueOf(A);
2389                }
2390                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2391                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2392                printToStream(A, strm);
2393                return bas.toString();
2394        }
2395        
2396        public static String toString(float[][] A) {
2397                if (A == null) {
2398                        return String.valueOf(A);
2399                }
2400                ByteArrayOutputStream bas = new ByteArrayOutputStream();
2401                PrintStream strm = new PrintStream(bas);
2402                printToStream(A, strm);
2403                return bas.toString();
2404        }
2405        
2406        public static String toString(RealVector x) {
2407                if (x == null) {
2408                        return String.valueOf(x);
2409                }
2410                else {
2411                        return toString(x.toArray());
2412                }
2413        }
2414        
2415        public static String toString(RealMatrix A) {
2416                if (A == null) {
2417                        return String.valueOf(A);
2418                }
2419                else {
2420                        return toString(A.getData());
2421                }
2422        }
2423        
2424        // --------------------
2425        
2426        public static void printToStream(double[] x, PrintStream strm) {
2427                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2428                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2429                for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {
2430                        if (i > 0)
2431                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2432                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, x[i]);
2433                }
2434                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2435                strm.flush();
2436        }
2437        
2438        public static void printToStream(double[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2439                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2440                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2441                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2442                        if (i == 0)
2443                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2444                        else
2445                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2446                        for (int j=0; j< A[i].length; j++) {
2447                                if (j == 0) 
2448                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2449                                else
2450                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2451                        }
2452                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2453                }
2454                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2455                strm.flush();
2456        }
2457        
2458        public static void printToStream(float[] A, PrintStream strm) {
2459                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2460                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2461                for (int i = 0; i < A.length; i++) {
2462                        if (i > 0)
2463                                strm.format("%c ", SeparationChar);
2464                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i]);
2465                }
2466                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2467                strm.flush();
2468        }
2469        
2470        public static void printToStream(float[][] A, PrintStream strm) {
2471                String fStr = PrintPrecision.getFormatStringFloat();
2472                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2473                for (int i=0; i< A.length; i++) {
2474                        if (i == 0)
2475                                strm.format("%c", LeftDelimitChar);
2476                        else
2477                                strm.format("%c \n%c", SeparationChar, LeftDelimitChar);
2478                        for (int j = 0; j < A[i].length; j++) {
2479                                if (j == 0) 
2480                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, fStr, A[i][j]);
2481                                else
2482                                        strm.format(PrintLocale, "%c " + fStr, SeparationChar, A[i][j]);
2483                        }
2484                        strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2485                }
2486                strm.format("%c", RightDelimitChar);
2487                strm.flush();
2488        }

2490        // Exceptions ----------------------------------------------------------------
2491        
2492        public static class IncompatibleDimensionsException extends RuntimeException {
2493                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2494                
2495                public IncompatibleDimensionsException() {
2496                        super("incompatible matrix-vector dimensions");
2497                }
2498        }
2499        
2500        public static class NonsquareMatrixException extends RuntimeException {
2501                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2502                
2503                public NonsquareMatrixException() {
2504                        super("square matrix expected");
2505                }
2506        }
2507        
2508        public static class SameSourceTargetException extends RuntimeException {
2509                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2510                
2511                public SameSourceTargetException() {
2512                        super("source and target must not be the same");
2513                }
2514        }
2515        
2516        public static class ZeroLengthVectorException extends RuntimeException {
2517                private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
2518                
2519                public ZeroLengthVectorException() {
2520                        super("vector length must be greater that 0");
2521                }
2522        }
